refsect1.title: DESCRIPTION
refsect1.para: With &dhpackage; users can manipulate target scheduling. New plan entries can be added, existing plan entries can be listed and deleted. Plan entries for a given target can be listed.

refentry.refsect1:
OPTIONS
&optiongnu;
--add target name or ID start time end time
Add new fixed schedule target. The end time is optional.
If start time or end time parameters are numbers preceeded wih + sign, they are interpreted as time offsets. Base time is time current system time for start time parameter, and start time value for end time. Please see examples at the end of this document for details.
--dump -n YYYY-MM-DD
Dump plan entries. Unless night is specified with -n option, the current night plan entries are printed on standard output.
-n YYYY-MM-DD
Specify night for which targets will be dumped, copied or deleted.
--load filename
Load plan from file (or standard input, if "-" is specified as filename). Plan entries are separated by new line, and have the format described in plan file format section.
The command tests for validity of IDs entered in the entry file. It refuses to load plan which contains IDs not present in the system.
--copy -n YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD
Copy plan from a single night to other night(s). The plan entries from plan for night specified with -n are copied to nights specified as arguments. The plan start and possibly (if filled) end dates are offseted with difference of sidereal time between the nights. This quarantees that the objects will be observed at the same horizontal position. If you wish to observe objects at the same time, please use --fixed-copy.
--fixed-copy -n YYYY-MM-DD YYYY-MM-DD
Similar to --copy, but keeps times unchanged. So if there is target scheduled at 22:00, and you copy it a month ahead, it will still remain scheduled at 22:00 (assuming time reference is not affected by daylight saving time change).
--target target name or id
Print plan entries for given target(s).
--delete -n YYYY-MM-DD plan id
Delete plan entry with given plan IDs., or being observed at given night.
&dbapplist;

refsect1.title: Plan file format
refsect1.para: This section describe format of the plan file, which can be used with --load to load a plan from file.

listitem.para: target ID, e.g. numerical value. Names are not supported.
plan entry start Time in RTS2 time format.
optional plan entry end time. Observation without end time are observed only once, e.g. the script is not repeated.

refsect1.para:
There is an example of the input file.
1001 2011-01-17T00:00:00 2011-1-17T00:10 1002 2011-01-17U00:20:00 1003 2011-01-17L00:40:00 2011-1-17T2
This introduce to the system three plan entries, all for 17th January 2011. Start times use mixed local and UT times - please see rts27 for details.
